Description: Copper alloy handle-ornament in the form of a cross, broken from a lamp; one arm of the cross is lost. At the rear is part of a ring-handle and a strut supporting the cross. Surface colouration: patchy dark and light green.
Curator's comments: Analysis: copper: 75.7; lead: 20.1; tin: 3.26; zinc: 0.33. label attached '2' (bailey 1996, 77)
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (3830)
